attributes.comment:
It is absolutely appaling that USCIS is rasing the fee for the permanent residency
application, work permits, advance parole etc. when it is simply unable to process
applications from LEGAL WORKERS who are being sponsored for their skills,
talents and contributions to the US Economy by leading US companies in a
timely manner. Unless USCIS can get rid of five-year long backlogs and expedite
application processing, raising the fees for various application categories will
further undermine the reputation (or at this point simply the lack of reputation and
inefficiency) of this government agency.

Moreover, in a global market where competition for talent is fierce, the United
States is certainly not going to be able to compete for the best with these fee
increases without a corresponding increase in the time it takes to process an
application. USCIS is viewed as a dismal failure in terms of its service quality and
responsiveness. Raising the fee is only going to make this agency look like a
bureaucracy that is doing nothing and making money!
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
